title: WSB-TV’s Jodie Fleischer leaving for NBC station in D.C. | Bukber Videos & News
text:
900 SHARES 
This was posted Wednesday, February 15, 2017 by Rodney Ho on his AJC Radio & TV Discuss weblog 
Award-winning Channel 2 Motion Information investigative reporter Jodie Fleischer is becoming a member of an NBC station in Washington D.C. 
She’s going to do investigative work for WRC-TV beginning subsequent month. WSB-TV workers was knowledgeable this morning. 
She’s the second reporter on the town leaving for D.C. previously week. 11 Alive’s Blayne Alexander can be transferring to D.C.. She can be working on the NBC NewsChannel affiliate information service , which does nationwide political tales for the NBC associates. Given what’s occurring with the Trump administration, D.C. is actually the place to be for information. 
Fleischer joined WSB-TV in 2007. She had beforehand labored in Orlando. 
“Her tales have led to legal guidelines being modified within the state of Georgia,” WRC information director Mike Goldrick instructed workers in D.C.. “Her work has obtained recognition from her friends in our enterprise, together with greater than a dozen Regional Emmy Awards and the celebrated Alfred I. DuPont award from Columbia College, one of many highest honors in broadcasting.” 
In 2015, Jodie was additionally honored by the FBI Director with a Neighborhood Management Award for a collection of investigative stories which uncovered Georgia’s authorized loophole that inspired widespread legal exercise by sovereign residents who used faux deeds to steal foreclosed houses. 
The ensuing regulation change was the end result of greater than 4 years of reporting. 
WSB-TV and The Atlanta Journal-Structure are each a part of Cox Media Group.
